verses.roman:
ei mate pratisūtre karena dūṣaṇa
śuni' camatkāra haila sannyāsīra gaṇa

synonyms: ei mate—in this way; prati-sūtre—in each and every aphorism; karena—shows; dūṣaṇa—defects; śuniyā—hearing; camatkāra—struck with wonder; haila—they became; sannyāsīra—of all the Māyāvādīs; gaṇa—the group.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu thus showed for each and every sūtra the defects in Śaṅkarācārya's explanations, all the assembled Māyāvādī sannyāsīs were struck with wonder.
